poem:
Grief and Echoes

Among the rubble,
a child's toy rests—
forgotten.
Mothers weep
where sand is blood-soaked,
figures lost
in a relentless tally.

Numbers obscure humanity,
but whispers 
of innocence
pierce through,
haunting.

In shattered silence,
humanity gasps—
still,
hoping.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war live: release of detained al-Shifa hospital director sparks political row in Israel 11.21am BST More than 37,900 Palestinians have been killed and 87,060 have been injured in Israel’s military offensive in Gaza since 7 October, Reuters reports the Gaza health ministry said in a statement on Monday. It has not been possible for journalists to independently verify the casualty figures being issued during the conflict. 11.20am BST Woman and child killed by Israeli". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Israel-Gaza war live: release of detained al-Shifa hospital director sparks political row in Israel 11.21am BST More than 37,900 Palestinians have been killed and 87,060 have been injured in Israel’s military offensive in Gaza since 7 October, Reuters reports the Gaza health ministry said in a statement on Monday. It has not been possible for journalists to independently verify the casualty figures being issued during the conflict. 11.20am BST Woman and child killed by Israeli
